resources.string:
Healthy diet for children 0 - 24 months: 
● It is important to breastfeed also after 6 months 
● It is important to start feeding the baby solid food like beans, vegetables and eggs after 6 months only. 
● It is important to feed the baby a variety of solid foods from 3 food groups 
 
● The 3 food groups are: 
Energy food (rice, wheat, potatoes ) 
Growth development foods (meat, fish, chickpeas and other pulses, yogurt, milk and egg 
Protective foods: Vegetables (green etc), fruits. 
● while feeding a child one should be patient and playful taking plenty of time
\n● While you are pregnant: It is important to eat food like beans, vegetables and dairy products when you are pregnant. \n● It is important to eat a balanced diet from all 4 food groups
\n● Baby: 0-6 months. Baby needs only breast feeding in this period. No additional food is needed. \n● Mothers should eat a balanced diet with plenty of pulses, vegetables and dairy products.

● Baby 6 - 9 months: Start giving the baby solid food after 6 months 
● The baby still needs breastfeeding 
● Use food from the 3 different food groups. It should be smooth and thick, without lumps” 
● Feed baby solid foods 3 times a day

● Baby 9 - 12 months: The baby needs solid food and breastfeeding 
● Feed baby 3 times a day, plus 1 snack 
● Use a variety of food from the 3 food groups

● Baby 12- 24 months: The baby needs solid food and breastfeeding 
● Feed baby solid food 3 times a day, plus 2 snacks 
● Use a variety of food from the 3 food groups 
●Twice a year, provide vitamin A supplement
